doc.field: Paths: UVA Cultural Landscape Survey GIS Datasets (Datastack)

This collection (stacked series) of datasets is provided to the UVA Library’s Scholars’ Lab by Andrew Green of the UVA Office of the Architect, and is provided AS-IS with no guarantees as regards to its accuracy or temporal currency. It is intended to document the historical physical evolution of the Grounds (campus) of the University of Virginia. * // * The temporal extents of the datasets in the datastack range from 1790 until the present day (2006), except for Landuse that ends in 1995, Topography in 1970, and Land Ownership in 1906. Except where noted, ALL datasets include initial construction/survey/startuse date as well as a demolition/termination date describing the time period during which the feature existed. Missing date info is coded as zero (0) when the beginning date is unknown, or as 2999 (or 1973 for topo) if there is no end date (feature still exists or is still in use). * // * Datasets/Layers included in this datastack (with non-exclusive list of included attributes): * Monuments and Statues * Springs (no time dates) * Trees - occasionally identified species. * Railroad and Trolley Lines * Walls - incl. construction material. * Hydrology - incl. aboveground or underground flow path. * Roads - incl. road name and surface type. * Paths * Land Use - incl. parcel name and type of use. * Buildings: UVA and Community - incl. building name, architect, original and current uses. * Topography - incl. elevation amsl. in feet (in NAME field). From maps/surveys covering the time periods 1790-1820, 1820-1899, 1899-1908, 1908-1921, 1921-1928, 1928-1930, 1930-1936, 1936-1950, 1950-1952, 1952-1970, and 1970. * Land Ownership - incl. owner’s name. From maps/surveys covering the time periods 1790-1820, 1820-1849, 1849-1866, 1866-1894, and 1894-1906.
